column4: can anyone tell me why mplayer works when I run it as mplayer -vo x11 (and how to make vlc and totem work in a similar fashion?)
For VLC you have to go to its preferences and change its video output thing.
do you kno what needs to be set exactly?
oh I need to change video output module to x11 then right?
because if I set it up that way, I could install programs and administer without having to log in as myself or root to do it, and at the same time the user wouldn't be able to mess anything up
Then just remove them from the admin group.
I want to be able to administer from anyone's account
How is it LESS secure to not have a root password?
because now any old bum who has sudo access is exactly the same as a full root
that means all you need for root access is ANYONE's access who is on sudo
Yeah but that's a bit harder to accomolish.
having full access to many users is not more secure than only to one imo.
I really don't see your point. If you don't want everyone to have root access, remove their sudo privileges.

my point is this: imagine a network of 40 people using ubuntu. every time you want to install something on someone's computer you have to go over and log out completely and then log in as root just to do it because they don't have sudo access. waste of time imo. wouldn't it be much nicer to have it where all you had to do is go to synaptic and type in the root pw?
Then like I said, look into editing /etc/sudoers to your whims.
that wouldn't help anything because I would still have to log out and back in as root
orly? let me take another look at that.
If you modify it right, it should.
alright well I'll look into it further then.. thanks for your attention
The flag you're looking for is rootpw by the way.
ok I will thanks
I can see that I might need this option soon so I want to be prepared for it is all.
